subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Speakers
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1218651239
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit



 
In a message dated 8/13/2008 12:54:25 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
cawiggins78@... writes:

 
 
 
 
What do you mean by proper wiring?


-----  Original Message ----
From: "Marlboro63@From: "Marlbo<Marlboro63@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsTo: 
Sent:  Wednesday, August 13, 2008 1:29:36 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC]  Speakers


Those speakers should work for what  you want to do.  But you could also get 
the proper wiring and run  directly into the recorder at the same time.  The 
choice is up to  you.
 
 
In a message dated 8/13/2008  12:25:19 P.M. Central Daylight Time, 
cawiggins78@ _yahoo.com_ (http://yahoo.com/)  writes:

 
 
 
 
I went  over to BigLots and got a set of Audio Zone 2.0 amplified speakers 
for about  6 bucks. They are 2W each with a 3" full range driver, pre-amplified 
and  magnetically shielded. Frequency response is 120Hz-20KHz. Are these just  
total crap, or are they comparable to what you're talking about? Man, I just  
wish I could run the mic and the 469 into the recorder with the  y-adapter.


----- Original Message ----
From:  "Marlboro63@ _aol.com_ (http://aol.com/) " <Marlboro63@aol. com>
To:  EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Wednesday, August 13, 2008 1:08:32  PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Speakers


The 469 uses a very low powered amplifier circuit on the headphone  jack.  
Stand computer speakers will not really work for it and you will  get a very low 
audio out of it if anything.  What you need is a small  set of amplified 
speakers.  Radio Shack sells a few seats that fold up  for around $20.00.  I got 
mine when they were on sale for $10.00.   Or any good amplified speakers will 
do the job for you.  But remember  the clocking on am.  The clicking will be 
amplified too so try and  ignore it if possible.
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 8/13/2008 12:05:35 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
cawiggins78@ _yahoo.com_ (http://yahoo.com/)  writes:

 
 
 
I hooked up these speakers and now I'm not getting a thing. I  guess
I'm using poor quality speakers. any suggestions on which  speakers
work the best with the 469?
